sentences: Osav kirurg, kokk, rätsep, kütt, akrobaat.
Poiss on osav palli püüdma, puu otsa ronima.
context: The Estonian adjective 'osav' describes someone who is highly skilled, clever, or proficient at something. It can refer to technical abilities (like surgery, cooking, woodworking) as well as mental skills (diplomacy, speaking). The word implies both competence and intelligence - the ability to perform tasks skillfully, cleverly, or adeptly. 'Osav' often carries a positive connotation of natural talent combined with acquired skill.
